DataElement.preferredName: Prior And/Or Concurrent Plasma Cell Disease or Disorder Present Specify Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free-text field to describe the prior and/or concurrent plasma cell disease or disorder.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prior And/Or Concurrent Plasma Cell Disease or Disorder Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid._Occurring or operating at the same time._A type of immune cell that makes large amounts of a specific antibody. Plasmacytes develop from B cells that have been activated.  A plasmacyte is a type of white blood cell._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Prior And/Or Concurrent Plasma Cell Disease or Disorder
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.:Occurring or operating at the same time.:Specialized forms of antibody-producing B-LYMPHOCYTES. They synthesize and secrete immunoglobulin. They are found only in lymphoid organs and at sites of immune responses and normally do not circulate in the blood or lymph. (Rosen et al., Dictionary of Immunology, 1989, p169 & Abbas et al., Cellular and Molecular Immunology, 2d ed, p20):Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
Occurring or operating at the same time.
A fully mature B-Cell that produces a specific antibody.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
